meanings.definition: Make unable to act or function properly
meanings.sent1: A broken leg incapacitates a person from walking.
meanings.sent2: The flu virus incapacitates many people each year.
meanings.sent3: Wearing shoes on the wrong feet incapacitates your ability to walk comfortably.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain incapacitates the small stream from flowing smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The magician's spell incapacitates the audience with laughter.

meanings.definition: Cause to be unable to move or feel normally
meanings.sent1: An injury to the spine can incapacitate movement in the legs.
meanings.sent2: The spider's venom can incapacitate its prey within seconds.
meanings.sent3: Eating too much ice cream can incapacitate your ability to resist a brain freeze.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise of the fireworks incapacitates the dog's sense of hearing.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the cave incapacitates the explorers' sense of sight.
